title: "function defined here" notes shouldn't show `mut`s

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

In https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90886 I changed the definition of `fold` such that it no longer needed the `mut` on the `f` parameter, and was surprised to get a UI test failure (in <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/test/ui/issues/issue-3044.rs>) from it.  The update from `bless`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18526288/141662958-b0496b48-2d11-41a8-90d9-ead8dbf646b0.png)

Playground link with the same as that UI test: <https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=548bf44a26aa1406bafb496f9341bf29>

It doesn't seem to be showing the note in playground, though?!?

The current output is:
```
 note: associated function defined here
  --> $SRC_DIR/core/src/iter/traits/iterator.rs:LL:COL
   |
LL |     fn fold<B, F>(mut self, init: B, mut f: F) -> B
   |        ^^^^
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
 note: associated function defined here
  --> $SRC_DIR/core/src/iter/traits/iterator.rs:LL:COL
   |
LL |     fn fold<B, F>(self, init: B, f: F) -> B
   |        ^^^^
```

because the `mut`s are not relevant to the caller of the function.
